title: Gradle Sync failed in Android SDK version 3.1 Gradle version 4.4
body:
Hello, My android Studio version is 3.1 Gradle version is 4.4. Gradle project sync failed. the message is > The versions of the Android Gradle plugin and Gradle are not compatible. Please do one of the following:
  • Update your plugin to version 2.4. This will require changes to build.gradle due to API changes. Open migration guide
  • Downgrade Gradle to version 3.5. Fix Gradle wrapper and re-import project
I had to do some changes in order to succeed to Sync gradle.

title: App doesn't identify the SHT31 sensor
body:
Hello Sensirion,

I'm running the smart gadget on an Android version 5.0.2, locations and Bluetooth services enabled.
Yet I can't connect to my sensor. Bluetooth and Locations in my phone seems to be working well with other instruments and /or apps.

The sensor itself seems to be fine cause I'm logging to it from other phones. 

Can you tell me what might be the problem? Is the Android version too old? In the google playit says that it should be working with Lolipop and up.

Thnaks,
Eyal

thanks a lot

title: Permission <READ_PHONE_STATE> is declared but not used
body:
Hello, I'm Denis Bogdanas, a research assistant at Oregon Stat University.
I'm working on a tool that automatically introduces runtime permission checks and requests for Android 6 apps. As part of this study I analyzed this app. I was looking at the way permissions are referred in the code.

This app declares permissions <READ_PHONE_STATE> in the apk manifest, but doesn't have any code that requires them. It is possible that source code doesn't declare the permissions. I only analyzed apk builds from f-droid. Yet android build mechanism may introduce them when the app uses certain libraries:

https://commonsware.com/blog/2015/06/25/hey-where-did-these-permissions-come-from.html

It won't create any problems on Android 6, but on Android 5- users may wonder why the app needs these permissions and be skeptical of installing the app.

Do you think this is an issue?

best regards,
Denis

title: Android automatic refactor - ObsoleteLayoutParam
body:
Hi,

I am developing a tool to automatically refactor Android applications with the goal of improving energy efficiency.
This pull request has the changes generated while applying the rule "ObsoleteLayoutParam".

While developing your application's views you might be specifying attributes in a view's artefact that are not necessary due to the nature of its parent. In this PR, those attributes were replaced by a comment.

I have made a previous validation of the changes and they seem correct.
Unfortunately, this tool is not able keep the original whitespace of the files, so comparison without ignoring whitespace might be confusing.
Please consider the changes and let me know if you agree with them.

Best,
Luis

body:
Hello,
I use AndroidStudio Version 2.2.2. I have a Nexus 6P and I am trying to read data with the app. Unfortunately I always get a blank readings screen. Any help here please ?

title: paired, but not discovered
body:
Hello!

I have two [SHT31s](https://www.sensirion.com/products/humidity-sensors/development-kit/), and [the app v1.8.1](https://f-droid.org/repository/browse/?fdid=com.sensirion.smartgadget) on a [S4mini with CyanogenMod](https://wiki.cyanogenmod.org/w/Serranoltexx_Info) 13. The phone pairs with the SHT31s, but the app doesn't discover them under `Settings > Connections > Smart Gadgets` (screenshot from the app switcher at the bottom).

Whenever the app asks for Bluetooth permissions, I click allow. I tried in Flight mode and with all other apps closed. [BLExplorer](https://f-droid.org/repository/browse/?fdid=org.ligi.blexplorer) I sees "Smart Humigadget" & also connects. However, the Smart Gadget app scans without ever discovering the SHT31 :-(

What could be wrong here? What info can I provide to help the trouble-shooting? Thanks for any help with this issue :-)

![img_20161126_111320](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/757323/20639874/fc3f3528-b3cf-11e6-9ac0-5e5a76fd18a1.jpg)
![screenshot_20161126-115851](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/757323/20639916/9b39a000-b3d0-11e6-85e1-56ac85ec9e48.png)
![screenshot_20161126-111245](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/757323/20639850/f893868c-b3ce-11e6-9273-a82d9a59032e.png)

title: X-axis labels in plots unevenly distributed/missing values
body:
Running with 1 min of logging interval and live connection the X-axis labels in the 10 min view change while the screen is being updated. I would expect the view to show 10 to 0 constantly, but instead it displays

- 9  7  6 ... 0
- 8  7  6 ... 0
- 9  8  6 ... 0

in some unpredictable manner with each screen update. I could understand some update when the data is also scaled, but just the axis labels seem to change.

Within the "1 Hour" view labels are just unevenly distributed meaning distance is equal, but values are not equally spaced: 53  46  40  33  26  20  13  6  0 Perhaps the calculated distance is 6.5 min, but this is rounded in some way.

"6 Hours" and "1 Day" is going well, displaying 6 labels at the end of 6 intervals (1 hour/4 hours) and are always he same. One would expect the "1 hour" to be displaying 50  40  30  20  10  0 following that scheme, but strangely it is not.

The week view misses a whole day (today its Sunday, on Monday it was Friday), so always today-3 is not shown?! Additionally where "today" should be (right end of the screen) the display is always one day ahead (now: Thu but it is Wed - at least in my timezone ;-))

title: Fix aggregation of RH and T values for download
body:
This fixes a serious bug in the download feature that would lose three out of four data points, see the commit message below.

Even after fixing this bug, there are still more strange issues, I documented them here: #31.

When downloading logged RH/T values, these do not arrive in pairs,
but independently. Also, they arrive in packets, so several RH values
might arrive before the corresponding T value does. The code to
aggregate these values in pairs did not account for this, losing
three out of four values by overwriting them in the aggregator.

There are now two different aggregation strategies for live and
logged data: for live values, the timestamp is ignored, for historic
values it is not.

title: Small fixes
body: Some fixes I thought would make sense

title: Bug: Strange gaps when downloading logged data
label: [Label(name="bug")]
body:
Both effects are observed with a logging interval of 10 minutes.

When downloading logged data, I reproducibly get a gap in the data as shown in the plot. I wiped the application data and then immediately performed a download. Can anyone reproduce this?
![screenshot_20160929-114216](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/140848/18949767/0535a862-863d-11e6-8b18-38954b93562b.png)
![screenshot_20160929-114225](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/140848/18949768/05362d1e-863d-11e6-8aff-fec4197d9094.png)

Also, for a logging interval of 10 minutes, the newest point is shown to be older than 10 minutes which cannot be. I assume there is an error in the timestamp calculation, so it might be a bug in libble.

![screenshot_20160929-114229](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/140848/18949769/05388d52-863d-11e6-9b91-8e0a4e5db23e.png)

When investigating the second issue, I found the documentation of the BLE protocol sorely missing. All I found is https://github.com/Sensirion/SmartGadget-Firmware/blob/master/Simple_BLE_Profile_Description.pdf . This lists the available characteristics, but does not explain their meaning and how you would use them when performing a download. Could you add more information to this? I am especially interested in the characteristics OldestTimestampMs, NewestTimestampMs and SyncTimeMs

title: Include SmartGadget Application in the official F-Droid Repository
body:
Since this is a true open-source application (from what I can tell, all dependencies are open source as well), it would be a shame not to include it in the F-Droid repository.

I will look into this and keep this issue updated.

title: Feature Request: Dew Point in the History plot
body: The dew point is a really handy and descriptive measurement for the absolute humidity. I would like to see it as an option in the history tab as well.

title: Feature Request: Exporting Data
body: From what I can tell, there is no easy way to get the data out of the application in the moment. I want a save / share button that lets you export data in a human readable text format.

title: Feature Request: Panning in Plot
body:
Currently the history plot only supports 5 preset zoom levels and does not allow panning in the data. The preset zoom levels probably make sense, but it would be really helpful if I could look at old data in some more detail.

My proposal is to implement panning along the time axis and maybe in the y-axis as well, keeping the zoom levels constant.

I might start working on this, let me know if you are too.

title: Update android support library to the version '23.2.1'
Improve gadget connection speed
body:
- Improves connection speed when connecting with a Sensirion gadget.
  When connecting there is a blocking screen until the device is
  receiving RHT notifications, instead of waiting for the device settings
  data.

title: Update application dependencies
label: [Label(name="question")]
body:
- Update Android support library to the version '23.2.0'
- Update Libble library to the version '1.0.1'

title: Update Gradle tools to the version '1.5.0'
Fix Comfort Zone not displayed on the 'ComfortZoneFragment'
label: [Label(name="reviewed")]

title: Cache latest sensor measurement data
label: [Label(name="reviewed")]
body:
- The latest sensor measurement data is stored on the RhtSensorFacade. When
  a fragment, or a listener is registered, is automatically notified of the
  latest sensor values. Fragments will have immediatly the latest sensor data
  and will not have to wait until the Humigadget devices sends a new
  notification again.

title: SGA-63: Fix bug where 'ComfortZoneTest' did not run
body:
- The issue was produced because they where some code refactoring on the
  'ComfortZoneFragment' and the test code was not refactored, so all the test
  refractions failed
- NOTE: The test results are not stable on some devices, a refactor on
  the ComfortZoneFragment should be done in order to fix the issue

title: SGA-63: Fix periodic wrong values
body:
- Fixes a bug that, every period of time, on some devices and some
  gadgets, the temperature values sometimes drops to -45ºC, or even
  lower, without further notice. This bug is fixed by despising all data
  points with a temperature or a humidity value with that are not
  feasible.

title: Manage device fragment refactor
body:
- Inject all Views using the Butterknife library
- Add NullPointerExceptions checks around all the class in order to
  avoid crashes
- Annotate some parameters with @NonNull or @Nullable
- Rename a XML tag with a confusing name
- Refactor code for avoiding lines with a length greater than 120
  characters

title: Refactor the class 'HistoryIntervalType.java'
body:
- Add @NonNull, @Nullable and @StringRes annotations around
- Refactor code for avoiding lines with a length greater than 120
  characters

title: Line lenght small refactor
body:
- Refactor code for avoiding lines with a length greater than 120
  characters
- Use the RhtDatapoint ‘toString()’ overload when logging the received
  datapoint

title: Dashboard refactor
body:
- Annotate some parameters with @NonNull or @Nullable
- Add annotation for calling the ‘addAll’ and ‘clear’ methods within an
  UI thread. (Avoid some exceptions, avoiding some possible regressions)
- Refactor code for avoiding lines with a length greater than 120
  characters

title: Refactor XmlFloatExtractor.java
body:
- The class is a final class, not an abstract class, and has a private
  constructor for avoiding that an user instances it.
- Refactor ‘getFloatValueFromId’ method
  - Add ‘@DimenRes’ annotation
  - Add javadoc

title: SGA-60: Implement Butterknife on the ComfortZone view classes
body:
- Rename some XML tags in order to avoid confusions
- Refactor code for avoiding lines with a length greater than 120
  characters

title: SGA-60: Refactor 'SmartgadgetPreferenceFragment'
body:
- Bind XML strings using the BUTTERKNIFE library
- Refactor de preference adapter to use the ViewHolder pattern
- Prefer ‘getContext()’ rather than ‘getParent()’  whether possible
- Rename all prefix named ‘obtain’ to ‘get’ in order to follow project
  conventions
- Refactor code for avoiding lines with a length greater than 120
  characters
- Avoid some possible NullPointerExceptions if the parent activity is
  not a ‘MainActivity’. (Logs an error instead)

title: SGA-60: Refactor the 'ScanDeviceFragment'
body: @abrauchli

title: SGA-61: Fix 'not-running test' bug
body:
- Refactor ‘DeviceNameDatabaseTest.java’
  - Test class extends ‘android.test.AndroidTestCase’
  - Remove test not related to the testing of the methods from the
    DeviceNameDatabase repository.
  - Annotate all asserts with messages
  - Fix some possible NullPointerExceptions
  - Fix the bug ‘SGA-61’, producing test cases not running properly

title: Remove some extra lines on the test packages
SGA-60: Fix "Humigadget Settings cannot be entered"
body:
- If the user wants to open the settings of a connected but not
  synchronized Humigadget (The application does not have all the
  necessary information for entering the ManageDeviceFragment), the
  application will force all the obtention of all the necessary data.

title: Prefer 'Context' rather than 'Activity' usage on the ScanDeviceFragment
body:
- ‘getActivity’ produces sometimes NullPointerExceptions on some
  devices, under certain circumstances. Change ‘getActivity’ to
  ‘getContext’ whether possible on the ScanDeviceFragment.
- Do direct calls to the BleManager() whether possible, using the
  Context instead of the Activity.

title: Close 'Connection in Progress' dialog on device disconnection
body:
- Fixes a bug where, in case a device becomes disconnected while there
  is a connection dialog waiting for that particular device synchronization,
  that connection dialog stayed open for a few more seconds.
